ygData.subject: RE: [cantera] Numerical Python 22.0
ygData.msgSnippet: Dave, I have found the problem. The version of Numeric must match the version used when the Cantera python interface is built. I built it using version 21,

Dave,

I have found the problem. The version of 'Numeric' must match the
version used when the Cantera python interface is built. I built it
using version 21, and so it doesn't work with version 22. I downloaded
and installed Numeric 22 and rebuilt the Cantera python interface, and
then it worked fine with 22 but not when I re-installed version 21...

So, as you thought, if you compile from the source, any version of
Numeric should work. But the binary is specific to one version of
Numeric. I will keep the binary version compatible with Numeric 21 for
now, since this is what most people have downloaded.

Thanks for pointing out this issue.

Dave G.




-----Original Message-----
From: E David Huckaby [mailto:e.david.huckaby@...] 
Sent: Tuesday, February 11, 2003 6:47 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Numerical Python 22.0


Hello all,

The binary install of Numerical Python 22.0 seems to be incompatible
with 
the binary install of current Cantera (1.3.5) and well as the revision
of the
previous version (1.3,1.3r4,1.3r5).   The four flame examples would
crash 
during the beginning of the calculation phase.   I would imagine that if
you 
compiled from sources, this would not be a problem.   Fortunately, using

the Numerical  Python 21.0 binary from the Cantera website fixes this
problem.

Dave
